Daughter of Hell, insatiate power,</br>Destroyer of the human race,</br>Whose iron scourge and madd'ning hour</br>Exalt the bad, the good debase;</br>Thy mystic force, despotic sway,</br>Courage and innocence dismay,</br>And patriot monarchs vainly groan</br>With pangs unfelt before, unpitied and alone!

When first to scourge the sons of earth,</br>Thy sire his darling child design'd,</br>Gallia receiv'd the monstrous birth—</br>VOLTAIRE inform'd thy infant mind;</br>Well-chosen nurse!  his sophist lore</br>He bade thee many a year explore!</br>He mark'd thy progress, firm though slow,</br>And statesmen, princes, leagued with their invet'rate foe.

Scared at thy frown terrific, fly</br>The morals (antiquated brood);</br>Domestic Virtue, social Joy,</br>And Faith that has for ages stood:</br>Swift they disperse, and with them go</br>The friend sincere, the gen'rous foe.—</br>Traitors to God and man avow'd,</br>By thee now rais'd aloft, now crush'd beneath the crowd.

Revenge, in blood-stain'd robe array'd,</br>Immersed in gloomy joy profound;</br>Ingratitude, by guilt dismay'd,</br>With anxious eye wild glancing round,</br>Still on thy frantic steps attend:</br>With Death, thy victim's only friend,</br>Injustice, to the truth severe,</br>And Anguish, dropping still the life-consuming tear.

Oh swiftly on my country's head,</br>Destroyer, lay thy ruthless hand;</br>Nor yet in Gallic terrors clad,</br>Nor circled by the Marseilles band,</br>(As by th' initiate thou art seen),</br>With thund'ring cannon, guillotine,</br>With screaming Horror's funeral cry,</br>Fire, Rapine, sword, and chains, and ghastly Poverty.

Thy sophist veil, dread goddess, wear,</br>Falsehood insidiously impart;</br>Thy philosophic train, be there,</br>To taint the mind, corrupt the heart;</br>The gen'rous virtues of our isle,</br>Teach us to hate and to revile;</br>Our glorious Charter's faults to scan,</br>Time-sanction'd truths despise, and preach THY RIGHTS OF MAN.</br>
